description.en:
A great deal of attention is given to the physical chemical processes that ensure the functioning of living organism  in the steady-state conditions. Colloidal solutions in the body are dealt with a great detail.  An introduction to analytical methods used in modern medicine is also made.
A series of laboratory works is an important part of this course.
description.et: Kursusel käsitletakse organismide elutalituse aluseks olevate keemiliste protsesside kulgemise seaduspärasusi.  Vaadeldakse lähemalt vesilahustes asetleidvate protsesside toimumist, sõltuvalt lahuse pH-st, hüdrolüüsist, osmoosist. Õpitakse tundma termodünaamika ja kineetika seadusi ning nende rakendamist keemiliste reaktsioonide korral. Tutvutakse kolloidsüsteemides kehtivate seaduspärasustega ja mõningate kaasaegses meditsiinis kasutatavate analüüsimeetoditega.

objectives.en: The course is intended to provide knowledge of the physico- chemical basis of the processes occurring in living organisms and basic principles of colloid systems. Explain the principles of operation of some analytical techniques.
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärgiks on selgitada organismides kulgevate protsesside füüsikalis-keemilisi ja kolloidsüsteemide  aluseid ning anda ülevaade meditsiinis kasutatavatest analüütilistest meetoditest.

learning_outcomes.en:
The learning outcome of Medical Chemistry provides theoretical knowledges and basic concepts of chemistry to understand the principal processes in human body, describes the chemical mechanisms, their physicochemical origin and introduces some instrumental analysis methods.

General learning outcomes:
1.	Knows and is able to use basic chemical concepts, symbols, units correctly.
2.	Can relate between basic theoretical knowledge of chemistry with real life examples.
3.	Has systematic knowledge of the substance construction fundamentals. Can evaluate the influence of parameters on process equilibrium and kinetics 
4.	Can critically evaluate and distinguish relevant information from irrelevant, apply theoretical knowledge in solving fundamental acid equilibria, solution concentrations, and osmotic pressure problems.
5.	 Can describe processes occurring at interfaces and colloidal systems and explain their physico-chemical bases.
6.	Distinguishes instrumental analysis methods and knows their principle. Knows and is able to evaluate parameters affecting the quality of the instrumental analysis. Is able to choose the method necessary for sample analysis.
learning outcomes of the practice
7.	Knows the essential safety requirements for working in a laboratory, is able to plan safely and carry out simple practical tasks.
8.	 Knows the basic techniques of working in a laboratory and is able to use the general laboratory supplies and equipment correctly.
9.	Is able to present experimental results both in written and oral form, to critically analyze them, to interpret them, to draw corresponding conclusions, and to make connections.

1.	The student's written, and oral expression skills will be developed as part of the practice of reproaching and answering practical assignments. Teamwork planning and teamwork skills will be developed.
2.	Mathematical competence, analytical skills, and the ability to make inferences are developed.
learning_outcomes.et:
Meditsiinilise keemia kursuse raames omandab üliõpilane keemia põhiteadmised mõistmaks inimorganismis toimuvate protsesside seaduspärasusi, keemilisi mehhanisme ning füüsikokeemilisi tasakaale ja instrumentaalanalüüsi meetodeid. (meditsiinilise keemia kursuse kava vastab arstiteaduse erialaainete mooduli õpiväljundile 1 ja 9)

Üldised õpiväljundid:
1.	Teab ja oskab korrektselt kasutada keemia-alaseid põhimõisteid, sümboleid, ühikuid.
2.	Oskab luua seoseid teoreetiliste keemia alaste põhiteadmiste ja eluliste näidete vahel.
3.	Omab süsteemseid teadmisi aine ehituse põhialustest. Oskab hinnata parameetrite mõju protsessi tasakaalule ja kineetikale.
4.	Oskab kriitiliselt hinnata ja eristada olulist informatsiooni ebaolulisest, rakendada teoreetilisi teadmisi alus-happe tasakaalude, lahuse kontsentratsioonide ja osmootse rõhu ülesannete lahendamisel.
5.	Oskab kirjeldada piirpindadel ja kolloidsüsteemides toimuvaid protsesse ja selgitada nende füsikokeemilisi aluseid.
6.	Eristab instrumentaalanalüüsi meetodeid üksteisest ja teab nende põhimõtet. Teab ja oskab hinnata instrumentaalanalüüsi kvaliteeti mõjutavaid parameetreid. Oskab valida proovi analüüsiks vajalikku meetodit. 

Praktikum
7.	Teab laboris töötamise peamisi ohutusnõudeid, oskab ohutult planeerida ning läbi viia lihtsamaid praktilisi töid. 
8.	Teab laboris töötamise põhilisi töövõtteid ja oskab korrektselt kasutada lihtsamaid laboritarvikuid ja aparatuuri.
9.	Oskab nii kirjalikult kui ka suuliselt esitada eksperimenditulemusi, neid kriitiliselt analüüsida, tõlgendada ja teha vastavaid järeldusi ning luua seoseid.

Ülekantavad oskused: 
1.	Praktiliste tööde teotamise ja vastamiste raames arendatakse üliõpilase kirjalikku väljendusviisi ja suulise eneseväljenduse oskusi. Arendatakse meeskonnatöö planeerimise ja meeskonnas töötamise oskuseid. 
2.	Arendatakse matemaatikapädevust, analüüsi ja järelduste tegemise oskust.

description.et: Seminar calculation test (concentration calculations, pH and osmosis). Seminar test work is completed at 70% of maximum points.
Test in Physical Chemistry.  Physical Chemistry lecture test is completed at 60% of maximum points and 51% under each topical question maximal points.
Test in Colloid Chemistry. The colloid Chemistry lecture test is completed at 60%  of maximum points.
Test in Analytical Chemistry. The analytical Chemistry lecture test is completed at 60%  of maximum points.

During the semester, a homework assignment on physical chemistry is given every week (for example: watching a lecture video and taking a test). Homework assignments help learn the topics to be covered and prepare for contact hours (lectures) and written tests. All Homeworks must be completed. The homework must be solved within the given week, and the number of solving times is not limited. In order for the homework to be taken into account, at least 80% of the correct answers must be achieved. If necessary, homework can be done one week before the final test, but then the time and number of times are limited.

grade_preconditions.et: The lab-works tests are performed the lab works are done, accepted, and defended.

grade_evaluation.et:
The course has the non-differential assessment of learning outcomes, "pass" or "fail":
1. The lab-works moodle-tests are completed (the test is considered when at least 80% of the correct answers have been achieved), the lab works are performed, the lab work reports are accepted and defended.
2. Seminar test work must be completed at least 70% beyond the maximum points. Testing of the seminar is done during the semester.
3. Colloid and analytical chemistry tests must be completed at 60% of the maximum points.
4. Physical Chemistry: The home assignments are performed.  In a written test, all topics must pass at least 51% of the questions and overall 60% of the maximum points.

debt_elimination.et:
A retake of a test is possible in agreement with the corresponding teacher. All debts of practical works and seminars should be corrected by the end of regular schoolwork during the same semester.

According to the study regulation: 
If the student has committed academic fraud or behaved in an improper manner, the vice dean for academic affairs must [effective as of 1 January 2016]  reprimand the student, or make a proposal to the vice rector for academic affairs for the student to be deleted from the matriculation register.

description.et:
Introduction, Atom and chemical bond.
Atom (Quantum numbers and Atomic orbitals). Electronic structure in atom. Analytical methods based on atomic properties.
Chemical bond formation. Radicals. Covalent bond (sigma- and pi- bond), hybridisation. Delocalized bond. Electronegativity. Polarity of covalent bond and polarity of molecules. Ionic bond. Hydrogen- bond.

The Medical chemistry course presumes that the student has passed primary and high school full time chemistry courses. According to the national program student knows the principle structure of matte, inorganic and organic main compounds and its properties, main chemical reactions and the basics in chemical kinetics.

Solutions.
Solutions of the electrolytes and non-electrolytes. Concentration expressions. Ideal and real solutions. Colligative properties of the solution (osmotic pressure: iso-, hyper- and hypotonic solutions). Strong and weak electrolytes. Electrolyte classifications, electrolytes in organism. Acidic and basic properties of biomolecules.

Solutions.
Solutions of the electrolytes and non-electrolytes. Concentration expressions. Ideal and real solutions. Colligative properties of the solution (osmotic pressure: iso-, hyper- and hypotonic solutions). Strong and weak electrolytes. Electrolyte classifications, electrolytes in organism. Acidic and basic properties of biomolecules.

Kinetics.
Speed and speed constant of a chemical reaction. Rule of Culdberg-Waage.  Reaction order and molecularity. 0 and first order reactions. Activation energy and the temperature dependence of reaction rates. Chain reactions. Free radical in cell.
Catalysis. Enzymatic reactions. The equation of Michaelis-Menten.

Kinetics.
Catalysis. Enzymatic reactions. The equation of Michaelis-Menten.

Thermodynamics and bioenergetics.
Main terms in thermodynamics. I law of thermodynamics. II law of thermodynamics and reversibility. Entropy. Spontaneity and the Gibbs energy.

Bioenergetics. Chemical reactions as the basis of life. Cell bioenergetics and free energy. The thermodynamic principles in living systems, stationary state. Entropy and Gibbs free energy problem in living system. Coupled reactions. The role of ATP and phosphocreatine. ATP synthesis as  a coupled reaction.
